items.title: 1 Minute Late, 2 Hours Punished: This Attendance Policy Is a Legal and Cultural Disaster
items.description: Punctuality is important, but make sure you’re not breaking labor laws when you demand it of your employees.

items.title: Burnout Is an Operations Issue
items.description: Collectively, we need to fix the bottlenecks where burnout actually thrives.

items.title: Their Father Was on the Inc. 5000 in 1993—Now They Are Too
items.description: As co-founders of accounting platform Tight, Raj and Anu Bhaskar are following in their parents footsteps—all the way to the Inc. 5000

items.title: Why You Should Never Stop Trying to ‘Get Paid the Most’
items.description: A story about the nature of employment, and the power of charting your own course.

items.title: 150 Years Ago Vincent van Gogh Explained How to Lead a Good Life in Difficult Times. Modern Psychology Agrees
items.description: Vincent van Gogh led a famously troubled life, but his struggles taught him a lesson in resilience that science is now confirming.
